title: Oracle VirtualBox crStateCopyTexImage2D Out-Of-Bounds Write Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Oracle VirtualBox. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target guest system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the crStateCopyTexImage2D method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated object. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute code in the context of the hypervisor.
addtionnal_details: Oracle has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpuapr2019-5072813.html
timeline:
2018-10-14 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2019-04-17 - Coordinated public release of advisory
